Package prog10082.exercises.oop

Class Cat

java.lang.Object
prog10082.exercises.oop.Cat
public class Cat
extends java.lang.Object
Cat models some of the features of a real-world cat. This cat has a name and breed, and it could be hungry, so you can feed it. Warning: sometimes the cat pukes after eating!

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Cat()
    Constructs a default cat with a random name and breed.
    Cat​(java.lang.String name)
    Constructs a cat with a specific name and a random breed.
    Cat​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String breed)
    Constructs a cat with a specific name and breed.

  • Constructor Details

    • Cat

      public Cat()
      Constructs a default cat with a random name and breed. The cat will be hungry when it is first created so you'll want to feed() it.

    • Cat

      public Cat​(java.lang.String name)
      Constructs a cat with a specific name and a random breed. The cat will be hungry when it is first created so you'll want to feed() it.
      Parameters:
      name - the name for the new cat

    • Cat

      public Cat​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String breed)
      Constructs a cat with a specific name and breed. The cat will be hungry when it is first created so you'll want to feed() it.
      Parameters:
      name - the name for the new cat
      breed - the breed for the new cat

  • Method Details

    • setName

      public void setName​(java.lang.String name)
      Changes the name of this cat. Name can't be null or empty.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name for this cat

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Retrieves this cat's name.
      Returns:
      the name of this cat

    • getBreed

      public java.lang.String getBreed()
      Retrieves this cat's breed.
      Returns:
      the breed of this cat

    • isHungry

      public boolean isHungry()
      Is this cat hungry? Returns true if this cat is hungry, or false if this cat isn't hungry.
      Returns:
      true if the cat is hungry, false otherwise

    • feed

      public java.lang.String feed()
      Feeds this cat. Once this cat is fed, it is no longer hungry. Cats has a 5% chance of vomiting after eating, in which case they are still hungry afterwards. You can feed a cat even if it isn't hungry. Sometimes a cat realizes it's hungry once it sees food.
      Returns:
      String feedback about feeding this cat
      See Also:
      feed(String), feed(int, String)

    • feed

      public java.lang.String feed​(java.lang.String food)
      Feeds this cat a specific food item. Once this cat is fed, it is no longer hungry. Cats has a 5% chance of vomiting after eating, in which case they are still hungry afterwards. You can feed a cat even if it isn't hungry. Sometimes a cat realizes it's hungry once it sees food.
      Parameters:
      food - the item to feed this cat
      Returns:
      String feedback about feeding this cat

    • feed

      public java.lang.String feed​(int number, java.lang.String food)
      Feeds this cat a certain number of a specific food item. Note that if your food item is plural, you should type the plural form e.g. e.g. you can feed it 2 cookies. Once this cat is fed, it is no longer hungry. Cats has a 5% chance of vomiting after eating, in which case they are still hungry afterwards. You can feed a cat even if it isn't hungry. Sometimes a cat realizes it's hungry once it sees food.
      Parameters:
      number - the number of items to feed this cat
      food - the name of the item to feed this cat
      Returns:
      String feedback about feeding this cat

    • catInfo

      public java.lang.String catInfo()
      Retrieves information about this cat as a String. This includes the entire state of this cat: its name, breed, and if this cat is hungry.
      Returns:
      this cat's information
